sajid khan wrote:
> Hi,
> I dont want to save images and pdf files while crawling under the
> domainScope.
> So, I enabled the additionalScopeFocus filter and set it to return false
> when the below reg exp is satisfied:
> .*(?i)(*\\.(jpg|jpeg|gif|tiff|svg|pdf))$*<file://%5C%5C.%28jpg%7Cjpeg%7Cgif%7Ctiff%7Csvg%7Cpdf%29%29$/> 
> 
> 
> In spite of this, gif and jpegs get picked up. I can see that they're
> consuming a couple of MBs when I look at the crawl report.
> Can anybody please give pointers on how to fix it or where I may be going
> wrong?

In the classic scopes, the additionalScopeFocus filter can rule things 
in with a 'true' response, but not rule things out. A 'false' just means 
'this isn't something to be extra-added' -- if the URL still is accepted 
by the general scope, it's still in.

That's why in the newer, recommended, and usually more efficient 
DecideRule approach, every rule has both a test *and* a decision to 
apply. A proper sequence of rules can accomplish almost every effect 
imaginable.

In the classic scopes, to rule things out, set up excludeFilters.

If translating the classic approach to the chain-of-decide-rules 
approach, the rules would roughly be...

(1) Set initial decision to reject
(2) If seed, set decision to accept.
(3) If in 'focus' (domains in the case of DomainScope), set decision to 
accept.
(4) If 'additional focus' filter applies, set decision to accept.
(5) If transitively included by referring hops, set decision to accept.
(6) If 'excluded' filter applies, set decision to reject.

...with the last decision applied winning.

- Gordon @ IA
